p: A significant spatial cluster was detected in the south of the study area. The relative risk (RR) of homesteads inside the cluster compared to outside was 45.57 (p-value = <0.001) ( Fig 2). The results of the kernel density mapping for RVFV in homesteads ( Fig 3) suggest the greatest risk for RVFV seropositivity in the community was to be near Lake Victoria in the southwest of the study area.
